text: The goal was to only make one module that gets reused when building the email.  I ended up making 3, one for each section needed. Then making 3 emails for various number of modules needed.

Hello everyone.  Is there a way to make a two page landing page?  Pedigree info on the first page, then adding in a couple of questions on the second page.

I have been told that the time it takes to submit the landing page, may not be enough time for HubSpot to recognize the user and the two questions may not get attributed to the correct contact.

Any advice for this?

Gotcha you might want to check out what’s going on in <#CES6JU0RY|drag-drop-email-beta> because that might be an easier way to accomplish this.  FYI the PM who would get you in the beta is out today with St. Patricks day in Ireland as he’s based in our Dublin office
They already activated the beta for that on the account.  The issue was getting the modules to show up in that beta builder.
Ah I see, custom modules are showing up in the beta builder so perhaps its just not something that’s been rolled out to everyone yet
From a recent convo I had, if the form has the attributes you are looking to use for the second page on the form (and they are not populated via a workflow) you shouldn't run into any issues.
unless something has changed recently, I’ve still had to do the javascript trick to get the personalization token stuff on the thank you page
can you elaborate on the JS trick? not sure i know this one lol
basically you do the JS on form submit redirection trick but you use it to put query params into the URL with the form data you need to properly render the thank you page.
ah I see, nice lil trick
have to say I feel like my answer to a lot of HS issues/challenges is to use a query parameter :laughing:
agreed
A new way to do this without using a query param is to listen for the global `onFormSubmit()` and store fields in local storage or a cookie and check for that on the thank you page/next page
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/global-form-events>
<@UFBNA9K9A> that is a better more advanced way.

Hello everyone. It's been a pleasure. I'm developing my Vuejs Website and would like to add the HS forms into a component. I google it and didn't find a real code example. Is there any change someone have it? Thank you very much.
problem is you have to put a script tag inside your vue instance, think you need to do `v-once` on the wrapper element, and you may need to do something else to prevent vue from screwing with it
the fact the form is a react component might make things even more complicated not sure.
Hi John, thank you for the response.
Yes, I look at your post
I'm trying something like this
the span is pug
I think you’re on the right track. I think what may help you since you’re doing it that way- is to use the parameter specifying the id of the element to pop the form into
forget the parameter name.
but idk you might be a Vue skill level above me
You also may have better luck using axios to submit to the HS Forms API, that's how I would go about it

that’s also a great idea, theoretically I think you could even grab the form’s field types and whatnot FROM the forms API, haven’t done it but if you did figure that bit out and kinda make like a custom Form module that grabs the fields and lets you submit via the api as well. If you threw that on a github. you would be hero of the year

Hello! I’m Melissa and new to the developer tools. As a developer I need to sharpen my dev skills on HubSpot and working towards my certification. I look forward to connecting with other likeminded folks  on this channel
